Package org.cesecore.keys.validation

Class KeyValidatorSessionBean

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cesecore.keys.validation.KeyValidatorSessionBean
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CertificateValidationDomainService, KeyValidatorSession, KeyValidatorSessionLocal, KeyValidatorSessionRemote
    public class KeyValidatorSessionBean
extends Object
implements KeyValidatorSessionLocal, KeyValidatorSessionRemote
    Handles management of key validators.
    Version:
    $Id: KeyValidatorSessionBean.java 29947 2018-10-02 06:56:41Z aminkh $

      • getValidator

        public Validator getValidator​(int id)
        Description copied from interface: KeyValidatorSession
        Gets a key validator by cache or database.
        Specified by:
        getValidator in interface KeyValidatorSession
        Parameters:
        id - the identifier of a validator
        Returns:
        a BaseKeyValidator or null if a key validator with the given id does not exist. Uses cache to get the object as quickly as possible.

      • importValidator

        public void importValidator​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                            Validator validator)
                     throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                            KeyValidatorExistsException
        Description copied from interface: KeyValidatorSessionLocal
        Adds a key validator to the database. Used for importing and exporting profiles from xml-files.
        Specified by:
        importValidator in interface KeyValidatorSessionLocal
        Parameters:
        admin - AuthenticationToken of administrator.
        validator - the key validator to add.
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - required access rights are ca_functionality/edit_validator
        KeyValidatorExistsException - if key validator already exists.

        validator - the key validator to be modified.

      • removeKeyValidator

        public void removeKeyValidator​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                               int validatorId)
                        throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                               CouldNotRemoveKeyValidatorException
        Description copied from interface: KeyValidatorSessionLocal
        Removes the key validator data if it is not referenced by a CA. If the validatorId does not exist, the method returns without doing anything.
        Specified by:
        removeKeyValidator in interface KeyValidatorSessionLocal
        Parameters:
        admin - AuthenticationToken of admin.
        validatorId - the ID of the validator to remove
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - required access rights are ca_functionality/edit_validators
        CouldNotRemoveKeyValidatorException - if the key validator is in use

      • removeKeyValidator

        public void removeKeyValidator​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                               String validatorName)
                        throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                               CouldNotRemoveKeyValidatorException
        Description copied from interface: KeyValidatorSession
        Removes the key validator data equal if it is not referenced by a CA. If the validatorId does not exist, the method returns without doing anything.
        Specified by:
        removeKeyValidator in interface KeyValidatorSession
        Parameters:
        admin - AuthenticationToken of admin.
        validatorName - the name of the validator to remove
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - required access rights are ca_functionality/edit_validators
        CouldNotRemoveKeyValidatorException - if the key validator is referenced by other objects.

                             EndEntityInformation endEntityInformation,
                             RequestMessage requestMessage)
                      throws ValidationException
        Description copied from interface: KeyValidatorSessionLocal
        Validates dnsName fields defined in the SubjectAltName field of the end entity against CAA rules.
        Specified by:
        validateDnsNames in interface KeyValidatorSessionLocal
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - the authentication token of the administrator performing the action
        ca - the issuing CA
        endEntityInformation - the end entity object
        requestMessage - the incoming request message
        Throws:

      • validatePublicKey

        public boolean validatePublicKey​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                                 CA ca,
                                 EndEntityInformation endEntityInformation,
                                 CertificateProfile certificateProfile,
                                 Date notBefore,
                                 Date notAfter,
                                 PublicKey publicKey)
                          throws ValidationException,
                                 IllegalValidityException
        Description copied from interface: KeyValidatorSessionLocal
        Validates a key against the key validators which match the filter criteria defined in it and the CA reference to it. The method is invoked while certificate issuance for user certificates and CA certificates.
        Specified by:
        validatePublicKey in interface KeyValidatorSessionLocal
        Parameters:
        admin - the AuthenticationToken of the admin who requested the operation resulting in validation, used for audit logging, for example the admin requesting cert issuance
        ca - the issuing CA, or CA to be issued in case of a root or sub-ca.
        endEntityInformation - the end entity information
        certificateProfile - the certificate profile
        notBefore - the certificates notBefore validity
        notAfter - the certificates notAfter validity
        publicKey - the public key of the certificate
        Returns:
        true if all matching key validators could validate the public key successfully. If false #getMessage().size() is greater than 0.
        Throws:
        ValidationException - if the key validation failed. If the key validators failed action is set to abort certificate issuance KeyValidationFailedActions.ABORT_CERTIFICATE_ISSUANCE and validation fails, or the wrong algorithm type is chosen, message is NOT null. Exception of any technical errors are stored in the cause, and message is null.
        IllegalValidityException - if the certificate validity could not be determined.

      • validateCertificate

        public void validateCertificate​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken,
                                IssuancePhase phase,
                                CA ca,
                                EndEntityInformation endEntityInformation,
                                X509Certificate certificate)
                         throws ValidationException
        Description copied from interface: KeyValidatorSessionLocal
        Validates a generated certificate during issuance.
        Specified by:
        validateCertificate in interface CertificateValidationDomainService
        Specified by:
        validateCertificate in interface KeyValidatorSessionLocal
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - the authentication token of the administrator performing the action.
        phase - the certificate issuance process phase (IssuancePhase.
        ca - the issuing CA
        endEntityInformation - the end entity object
        certificate - the certificate to validate
        Throws:
        ValidationException - if the validation failed. If the validation failed action is set to abort certificate issuance KeyValidationFailedActions.ABORT_CERTIFICATE_ISSUANCE and validation fails, message is NOT null. Exception of any technical errors are stored in the cause, and message is null.

                                                    CertificateProfile profile,

      • getAuthorizedKeyValidatorIds

        public Collection<Integer> getAuthorizedKeyValidatorIds​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                                                        String keyValidatorAccessRule)
        Description copied from interface: KeyValidatorSessionLocal
        Retrieves a Collection of id:s (Integer) to authorized key validators.
        Specified by:
        getAuthorizedKeyValidatorIds in interface KeyValidatorSessionLocal
        Parameters:
        admin - the administrator for whom to get the profile ids he/she has access to
        keyValidatorAccessRule - an additional access rule which is required in order for it to be returned, for example REGULAR_EDITVALIDATOR to only return profiles only if the admin have validator create rights
        Returns:
        Collection of end key validator id:s (Integer)

      • getConflictingKeyValidatorIds

        public List<Integer> getConflictingKeyValidatorIds​(Validator validator)
        Description copied from interface: KeyValidatorSessionLocal

        Returns the ids for validators conflicting with a given key validator which is to be added.

        A new validator is conflicting either if it has the same id or if has the same name and type as an existing validator. A validator can be added to this session iff this method returns an empty list.

        Specified by:
        getConflictingKeyValidatorIds in interface KeyValidatorSessionLocal
        Parameters:
        validator - the validator to be added to this session
        Returns:
        a list of ids for conflicting validators, or an empty list if there are no conflicts

      • replaceKeyValidator

        public void replaceKeyValidator​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken,
                                LinkedHashMap<Object,​Object> data,
                                int id)
                         throws AuthorizationDeniedException
        Description copied from interface: KeyValidatorSessionLocal
        Replaces the settings of a key validator without changing its name or profile ID.
        Specified by:
        replaceKeyValidator in interface KeyValidatorSessionLocal
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - used for authentication
        data - the new settings of the validator
        id - the id of the validator to update
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - If unauthorized
